com.cloudant.sync.indexing

Interface IndexFunction<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FieldIndexFunction

    public interface IndexFunction<T>

    This interface defines the IndexFunction object used to map from document to indexed values by the IndexManager object.

    The Index function is called for every document as it's either inserted into the index for the first time, or its value changes and it needs to be updated.

    For an example, see FieldIndexFunction.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<T> indexedValues(java.lang.String indexName, java.util.Map map)
      Returns the values from the passed document that should be indexed.

    • Method Detail

      • indexedValues

        java.util.List<T> indexedValues(java.lang.String indexName,
                                java.util.Map map)

        Returns the values from the passed document that should be indexed.

        This method is assumed to be a pure function:

        • Calling it multiple times on the same document should produce the same output. For example, don't emit the current time.
        • It should not produce externally visible changes in program state.

        If it's not, behaviour is undefined.

        Parameters:
        indexName - The name of the index the values are destined for
        map - The document being indexed
        Returns:
        An object representing the value to be indexed. This must match the index's defined type.
